title: Joe Tetteh
text:
Joe Tetteh (10 December 1941 — 20 April 2002 (aged 60)) born in <a href="Accra">Accra</a> was a <a href="Ghanaian%20people">Ghanaian</a> <a href="professional">professional</a> <a href="super%20featherweight">super feather</a>/<a href="lightweight">light</a>/<a href="light%20welterweight">light welterweight</a> <a href="Boxing">boxer</a> of the 1950s, '60s and '70s who won the Ghanaian featherweight title, and <a href="Inauguration">inaugural</a> <a href="List%20of%20Commonwealth%20Boxing%20Council%20Champions%23light%20welterweight">British Commonwealth light welterweight title</a>, and was a challenger for the West African featherweight title against <a href="Lat%20Shonibare">Lat Shonibare</a>, British Commonwealth featherweight title against <a href="Floyd%20Robertson%20%28boxer%29">Floyd Robertson</a>, and All African lightweight title <a href="Ould%20Makloufi">Ould Makloufi</a><a href="http%3A//boxrec.com/list_bouts.php%3Fhuman_id%3D23638%26amp%3Bcat%3Dboxer"></a>, his professional fighting weight varied from , i.e. <a href="super%20featherweight">super featherweight</a> to , i.e. <a href="light%20welterweight">light welterweight</a>.
Tetteh fought around the world as a professional boxer, including in <a href="Sweden">Sweden</a>, <a href="Australia">Australia</a>, <a href="New%20Zealand">New Zealand</a>, <a href="Italy">Italy</a>, the <a href="United%20Kingdom">United Kingdom</a>—where he fought frequently—<a href="Spain">Spain</a> and <a href="France">France</a>. In his last bout as a professional, he boxed <a href="Ken%20Buchanan">Ken Buchanan</a>, being knocked out in three rounds by the Scottish future world champion and member of the <a href="International%20Boxing%20Hall%20of%20Fame">International Boxing Hall of Fame</a>.
